comments: A harmonic number is a harmonic seed if it does not have a proper unitary divisor (a divisor d such that gcd(d,n/d)=1) which is harmonic.
references: G. L. Cohen and R. M. Sorli, Harmonic Seeds, Fibonacci Quarterly, Vol. 36, No. 5 (1998), Pg. 386-390 MR1657575 (99j:11002)
links: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..138 (terms < 10^14)
author: _Jeff Burch_
